techmeme.title: The judge in Elon Musk's OpenAI lawsuit strikes down 16 of OpenAI's 55 affirmative defenses, accuses both sides of "gamesmanship" and over-litigating the case (Laura Italiano/Business Insider)
Sources: the US Commerce Department is discussing charging patent holders 1%-5% of their patent value, a radical move likely to spark pushback from businesses (Amrith Ramkumar/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: Mark Zuckerberg's aim with the Superintelligence Labs is to create a start-up-like unit within Meta that is unencumbered by the company's bureaucracy (Financial Times)
Lumana, which integrates vision-language models and agentic AI into its video surveillance system, raised a $40M Series A led by Wing Venture Capital (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
The UK Supreme Court denied Uber's appeal in a case over VAT, forcing Uber to pay a 20% VAT on fares outside London while rival private taxi operators pay none (Sam Tobin/Reuters)
